frameDefinitions: Partner_1 and Partner_2 or a group of Partners  work together in some Undertaking.
Two (or more) people (the Interlocutors, also encodable as Interlocutor_1 and Interlocutor_2) talk to one another.
The words in this frame have to do with people and the personal Relationships they are or can be a part of.
A Cognizer has a relatively fixed positive or negative point of view towards an Issue.
After having worked separately for some time, two or more organizational or individual Members are now organized in an Alliance so that they may better pursue some common Purposes.
frameExamples: CSTR actively <t>collaborates</t> with the Departments of Artificial Intelligence  and Physics.
I would rather <t>discuss</t> politics with anyone but him.
And of course that drippy <t><fex name='Partner_1'>boyfriend</fex></t> of hers backed her up.
In interviews , it seems like everyone is completely <t>against</t> this expenditure .
listRoleDefinitions: When the parties in a collaboration are expressed separately, this Frame Element marks constituents that express the one that is grammatically more prominent, i.e., the one that is the subject of an active clause.
This Frame element marks constituents expressing the grammatically  less prominent, typically oblique, party in a collaboration.
This frame element marks constituents that express the project in which the <fen>Partners</fen> are collaborating.
This frame element marks expressions that express the parties that work together in an <fen>Undertaking</fen>.
This role identifies the time when the <fen>Partners</fen> are engaged in their collaboration.
This role identifies the <fen>Place</fen> where the collaboration occurs.

In cases where the <fen>Interlocutors</fen> involved in a conversation are construed as two separate groups with different levels of volitionality or control, this role identifies the conversational participant with greater semantic and syntactic prominence, as compared with <fen>Interlocutor_2</fen>. That is, <fen>Interlocutor_1</fen> is generally encoded as Subject, and peripheral FEs that do not make reference to the event itself generally make reference to <fen>Interlocutor_1</fen>.  Thus a <fen>Purpose</fen> (or <fen>Means</fen>, <fen>Depictive</fen>, or <fen>Manner</fen>) is construed to be that of <fen>Interlocutor_1</fen>, not necessarily that of <fen>Interlocutor_2</fen> or the group of <fen>Interlocutors</fen> as a whole.

In cases where the <fen>Interlocutors</fen> involved in a conversation are construed as two separate groups with different levels of volitionality or control, <fen>Interlocutor_2</fen> refers to the semantically and grammatically less prominent group.  It is generally encoded within a prepositional phrase (e.g. headed by <ment>with</ment>).  Note that it is possible for a single role to correspond to multiple referents. For example, if the prepositional object in the example below were plural, we would still assign it the single role <fen>Interlocutor_2</fen>.

In some sentences both participants are expressed by the Subject, and there is no 'with'-phrase (cf example 1). In sentences like this, the Subject is assigned the role role <fen>Interlocutors</fen>. In such sentences, the Subject always denotes more than one person, and it is understood that the reciprocal communication takes place between these two (or more) people. The Subject may denote two or more people either through conjunction, as in example 1, or through plurality, as in example 2, or by denoting a group, as in example 3. In each of these cases the role <fen>Interlocutors</fen> is assigned. Notice that for nouns in the Discussion frame, it is possible for the <fen>Interlocutors</fen> role to be expressed by a prepositional phrase as in example 4.

<fen>Topic</fen> expresses the subject that the <fen>Interlocutors</fen> are trying to come to some agreement about.  It may refer, for example, to an undesirable issue that the <fen>Interlocutors</fen> want to have the proper response to, or it may refer more directly to an unresolved question.
The time at which the discussion takes place.
The location at which a discussion takes place.
That partner in the <fen>Relationship</fen> who is realized as the subject of verbs in active form sentences, or of adjectives in predicative uses.
That partner in the <fen>Relationship</fen> who is not expressed as the external argument.
The joint construal of both <fen>Partners</fen> in the <fen>Relationship</fen>.
The individual that holds an opinion on an <fen>Issue</fen> or Side.
The matter, usually concerning a course of action, which the <fen>Cognizer</fen> has a positive or negative opinion about.
The party or individual (generally associated with a particular position on an <fen>Issue</fen>) that the <fen>Cognizer</fen> has an opinion about.
An action taken by a <fen>Side</fen> or a view that the <fen>Side</fen> takes on an issue which the <fen>Cognizer</fen> either supports or opposes.
The time period during which the <fen>Cognizer</fen> has the indicated point of view towards the <fen>Issue</fen>.
The location where the <fen>Cognizer</fen> takes <fen>Side</fen>s on an <fen>Issue</fen> .
The entity of which the individuals are <fen>Members</fen>.
The persons or groups belonging to the <fen>Alliance</fen>.
That group or individual which has joined the <fen>Alliance</fen> which is grammatically more prominent when the <fen>Members</fen> are presented separately.
That group or individual which has joined the <fen>Alliance</fen> which is grammatically less  prominent when the <fen>Members</fen> are presented separately.
listRoleExamples: Britain is collaborating <fex>with France and West Germany</fex> in the development of anti-tank missiles
The two artists collaborated <fex>on a mosaic</fex>.
<fex>Last year</fex> some of my colleagues collaborated in the design of a theme-park.
<fex>In New Braunfels</fex> Paul and John collaborated in the design of a new Guggenheim
<fex>The President</fex> conferred with his top advisor.
The President debated <fex>with his top advisor</fex>.
(1) <fex>The President and his advisor</fex> discussed the Venezuelan situation briefly before the summit.
The President and his top advisors discussed <fex>the scandal</fex>.
<fex>Last year</fex> the participants discussed taking down the last trade barriers without consensus.
We just conferred for a couple of hours <fex>up in her room</fex>.
<fex>Last year</fex> she opposed the bill, but changed her mind after she received correspondence supporting the bill.
<fex>Our</fex> alliance with Japan is the cornerstone of Asia-Pacific security strategy.
Thanks in part to their coalition <fex>with McCoy</fex>, but thanks also to their seniority and the knowledge of some of their leaders, they hold considerable influence
